title: Sampler, 1702
medium:
Medium: silk and linen embroidery on linen
Technique: cross, montenegrin cross, eyelet, satin, double running, and detached looping stitches, withdrawn element work with needle lace fillings
signed: embroidered  "Alls Tanner her sampler  June ye 12 1702"
inscribed:
"If youth had known what now would crave
 How many a penny would youth have saved

 This tragous work which did me first afrite
 Overcame I with pashout and delight
  
 Much to your honor let these words credit your keeper
 Your parents may be glad "
provenance: ex. coll. Mrs. Henry E. Coe (Eva Johnston Coe)
creditline: Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe
description: Cross border of floral patterns and text. The same embroiderer made 1941-69-61.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 1702.
1702. Medium: silk and linen embroidery on linen
Technique: cross, montenegrin cross, eyelet, satin, double running, and detached looping stitches, withdrawn element work with needle lace fillings. Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe. 1941-69-60.
